ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] My source of income
ygData.msgSnippet: I did all this. and there must be something wrong with my game bc there is no HIDE button. :-( luv, -Su ... you ... find ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
ygData.messageBody:
I did all this. and there must be something wrong with my game bc there is
no HIDE button. :-(
luv,
-Su

> Click your abilities key, then right click one of the abilities buttons
you
> will se the hide button as one of the options. Left click it and it will
> become a new button.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 24, 2001 4:17 AM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] My source of income
>
>
>
> When I looked in my list of abilities, Hide wasn't there. I've tried to
find
> it but it's nowhere to be found. Could my game be bugged somehow then?
> Bc my DE Wizard has never had the Hide ability... She can't even train in
> it.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Dark elf wizards do get hide, at level 1, as do all
> > dark elfs.
> >
> >
> > --- Su <suceress@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > Clerics are invaluable in undead dungeons. Although
> > > not just undead. My
> > > cleric hardly ever has trouble finding a group.
> > > don't know if hide works. Never had a character that
> > > could hide..
> > > Btw, if all Dark Elves are supposed to be sneaky,
> > > why don't DE wizards get
> > > the Hide skill?
> > > luv,
> > > -Su
> > >
> > > > Heh...wish I could...but my parties never seemed
> > > to include anyone who
> > > could
> > > > cast it...
> > > >
> > > > just wondering....does the skill...hide...hide me
> > > from undead? doubt it
> > > >
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: Su [SMTP:suceress@...]
> > > > > Sent: Saturday, April 21, 2001 2:42 AM
> > > > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > > > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] My source of income
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > I just cast invis vs undead on myself and either
> > > hid or ran to the zone
> > > > > til
> > > > > things cleared up.
> > > > > luv,
> > > > > -Su
> > > > >
> > > > > > Yeah...I tried to group in Unrest(or is it
> > > Befallen...never can
> > > > > > remember...the place that drops small
> > > ringmail)
> > > > > > and the trains just kept wiping me out...died
> > > three times before I
> > > just
> > > > > left
> > > > > > the area.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > > > From: Danspath [SMTP:danspth@...]
> > > > > > > Sent: Thursday, April 19, 2001 9:55 AM
> > > > > > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > > > > > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] My source of income
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > An interesting idea...but you are 17? At
> > > about level
> > > > > > > 25 you can hunt critters that drop platinum
> > > loot plus
> > > > > > > fine steel weapons (5 plat per sell at
> > > vendor).
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- "IT3 Adam J. Daingerfield"
> > > > > > > <persona@...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > Starting Friday...I'm going to sit in
> > > Crushbone for
> > > > > > > > two hours and see how
> > > > > > > > many pp I can get if I really try to kill
> > > every
> > > > > > > > centurian I can find and
> > > > > > > > sell each belt for 1pp.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Oh and I'm using a level 17 Druid Sarakan
> > > on the
> > > > > > > > Bertoxx server
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > If I make enough money...I'm afraid I'll
> > > be one of
> > > > > > > > those who sit in an area
> > > > > > > > and farm the belts/pads for a living :>
> > > > > > > >
